gabh ... biadh ... eats food –
An do ghabh thu do bhiadh? Ghabh.
Did you eat your food? Yes, I did. td. 47
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Thug Seumas leis an t-slat-iasgaich agus thug Màiri leatha biadh ann am bascaid. [...] Nuair a bha an t-acras orra, shuidh iad air tolman agus ghabh iad am biadh a bha aig Màiri anns a’ bhascaid.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. James took the fishing rod with him and Mary took (with her) food in a basket. [...] When they were hungry, they sat down on a hillock and they ate the food that Mary had in the basket. td. 76

gabh ... òran ... sings a song –
Ghabh a’ chaileag seo òran aig a’ chéilidh.
This girl sang a song at the ceilidh. td. 47
An do ghabh thu òran? Cha do ghabh.
Did you sing a dong? No, I didn’t. td. 47
Có ghabh òran aig a’ chéilidh? Ghabh Alasdair.
Who ang a song at the ceilidh? Alexander did. td. 48
